Soviet Union, Gosudarstvennyi komitet po kinematografii motion picture film
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Vishnu Jani.

change.item: May 20, 2016: Corrected the extent - Vishnu Jani; September 26, 2012: Revised to add films list by Elizabeth Phillips

did.unittitle: Soviet Union, Gosudarstvennyi komitet po kinematografii motion picture film

physdesc.extent: 51 motion picture film reels (in 31 film canisters)

did.abstract: Relates to the role of the Soviet armed forces during World War II and subsequently.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Soviet Union. Gosudarstvennyi komitet po kinematografii.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Soviet Union, Gosudarstvennyi komitet po kinematografii motion picture film, Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1993.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Soviet governmental organization for supervision of motion picture film production.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of films that were made during the World War II era and the 1970s. The films were originally intended for use by military attaches and political or scientific officers at Soviet embassies and consulates. Used to demonstrate Soviet might and power, the films cover topics such as recruitment for, and life at, the Higher Frunze Naval Academy in Leningrad, navy recruiting, massive Soviet Army maneuvers, the Yuri Gargarin space tracking range ship, and the Soviet Army. Contains 31 film reel cans containing 51 reels of 16mm film of various lengths. Film titles taken directly from the canister or reel.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: For information on getting a use copy, please contact Hoover Institution Archives
